isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - WINDSHIELD WASHER BOTTLE WITH PUMP MOTOR

svcproc.title: WINDSHIELD WASHER BOTTLE WITH PUMP MOTOR

svcsubproc.title: Remove Windshield Washer Bottle with Pump Motor on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700 and 8500 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 123 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: The washer bottle (Item 1) and pump motor (Item 2) are located under the cab door on the driver side. Use the following steps to remove washer bottle and pump motor.
To remove the washer bottle (Item 1) with pump motor (Item 2) as a unit, follow the procedures below.
Disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 3) from pump motor (Item 2).
Disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 4) from the pig tail connector (Item 5) from the low fluid sensor (Item 6).
Remove windshield washer hose (Item 7) from pump motor outlet port (Item 8).

Squeeze together the tabs on the hose clamp (Item 9) on the remote fill hose (Item 10) coming from the remote fill cap, slide the hose clamp off the washer bottle fill port (Item 11). Pull the remote fill hose off the washer bottle fill port.

Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 12) securing washer bottle with pump motor (Items 1 and 2) to the washer bottle mounting brackets (Item 13). Save washer bottle with pump motor and hex flanged bolts for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
If any one of the four speed nuts (Item 14) located on each of the washer bottle mounting brackets (Item 13) are damaged, remove and replace them.
